snippet: A proposal to go back to using daylight saving time could mean increased television revenue for the Games in 2014, but hurt the legacy of President Vladimir V. Putin’s predecessor.
abstract: Officials in Russia are considering whether to go back to using daylight savings time when winter Olympics are held in Sochi in 2014, thus bringing Russian time closer to rest of Europe and adding television viewership and profitability of showing games in prime time; decision could affect legacy of former Pres Dmitri A Medvedev, who decided in 2011 that Russia should abandon daylight savings time.
lead_paragraph: A proposal to go back to using daylight saving time could mean increased television revenue for the Games in 2014, but hurt the legacy of President Vladimir V. Putin’s predecessor.
